The lyrics in this song "W.R.O.H." by Ab-Soul featuring Lupe Fiasco and Nikki Jean touch on themes of ambition, determination, self-awareness, and personal growth. The artists express a sense of focus and dedication to their craft, acknowledging the fast-paced nature of life while also emphasizing the importance of staying true to oneself and following one's dreams.

Ab-Soul's verses highlight his introspective nature and his ability to navigate through both success and obstacles. He references his past experiences and the challenges he has faced, all while maintaining a sense of resilience and determination to keep pushing forward. The line "Maybe I'm just a dreamer, and life is but a dream" reflects his contemplation on the nature of reality and his own aspirations.

Lupe Fiasco's verse adds to the introspective tone of the song, as he delves into deeper philosophical reflections on existence and the interconnectedness of life. He references his own journey and the impact of his actions, while also incorporating wordplay and metaphor to convey his complex thoughts.

Overall, the song conveys a message of perseverance, self-discovery, and the pursuit of one's goals despite the challenges that may arise. The artists use vivid imagery and clever wordplay to engage the listener and invite them to reflect on their own path in life.

The idea of not looking down and flying like an eagle suggests a sense of freedom and empowerment, even in the face of challenges. The lyrics also speak to the inevitability of change and the importance of letting go and moving on, as symbolized by the image of a phoenix rising from the ashes. There is a sense of longing and reflection on the past, as well as a recognition of the difficulty of letting go and moving forward. The lyrics also explore the complexities of relationships and the pain of separation, but ultimately there is a message of resilience and perseverance in the face of adversity. Overall, the lyrics convey a message of hope and growth through overcoming obstacles and embracing change.

Overall, the lyrics convey a sense of confidence and determination to continue pushing forward, no matter what obstacles may come their way. The artists celebrate their success while acknowledging the hard work and sacrifices that got them to where they are.

summary:
The lyrics in the song "Too Late" by Big Sean and Lupe Fiasco touch on themes of regret, missed opportunities, and the fear of being too late to achieve one's goals. The chorus specifically emphasizes the idea of it not being too late for redemption or for making changes in one's life. The verses delve into the consequences of being too late, such as losing relationships or opportunities.

The use of metaphors, such as the alarm clock signaling that it's too late or the imagery of riding in a Chevy instead of a Mercedes, convey the sense of urgency and longing for success. The mention of being second or third in the worst case scenario highlights the pressure to excel and the fear of not measuring up in a competitive world.

Overall, the song reflects on the struggle to keep up with time and to make the most of the present moment before it's too late. It explores the constant battle between chasing dreams and facing reality, and the importance of persevering despite setbacks and delays.

The chorus discusses the challenges and temptations individuals face while trying to navigate through life. The artists speak about the pressure to conform to materialistic desires and the difficulties of staying true to oneself in a world filled with distractions.

The bridge highlights the idea of rebellion and going against societal norms. Lupe Fiasco expresses a desire to break free from the constraints of societal expectations and pursue wealth and success through unconventional means. This can be seen as a metaphor for the struggle to find one's own path and identity in a world filled with external pressures.

Overall, the song explores the complexities of growing up in a society that may not always have the best intentions for its individuals. It encourages listeners to think critically about their values and goals, and to resist the temptation to follow the crowd or conform to societal norms. The artists convey a message of empowerment and resilience in the face of adversity, urging listeners to stay true to themselves and strive for their own version of success.

title: Always Shine
lyrics:
[Hook: Bilal]

Your inner heart, your inner mind
You're the star that will always shine
Forever you'll be with me


[Verse 1: Lupe Fiasco]
Uh, it go like

You ever see the inner depths of a man's soul?


Or ninja turtles pouring out of manholes?


This is balance


Between a comic and a conscious, that's the challenge


Between the solitary and the conference that I examines


That I imagine was a figure


Would be the start of world peace and the transformation of niggas


Like the transubstantiation of liquor
But that's just turnin' them into blood

And we'll be right back where we was

Not a peace-sign, but a fascination with scissors


So I can cut
Myself off from the calculations of empress, empires, and the sinners


For advancement of human suffering


And other things trying to impede my publishing and editorials


That's gon' bring it back to us again


A boomerang minus Halle Barry and Eddie
 and everybody fucking and huh'

[Hook: Bilal]

[Verse 2: Lupe Fiasco]

Shotgun
Even though independent cars ain't got one


I got some and more to spare
No more despair


My motor-ware don't match my motivate to mate


Also I drive to stay alive and ride this over there


My momma so mad, so no alcohol in here


I'm Aries Spears on my Jay-Z shit


Affion on the Drake skit


Now how many more can I make with just one voice
They might call it fake shit
This some deep shit
It's my me impersonatin' we shit
Vicariously in every rap I speak with
I hope you're speakin' for me, if I'm ever speechless


Cause I'mma be you
Even though you're not here to be with


I hope I see these gangsters actin' like teachers


Wake up out they sleep
, 
dare to dream

In 
a world so Martin Luther King-less


[Hook: Bilal]

[Outro: Lupe Fiasco]

And to my hero Heron, Gil Scott


In a discourse with Baldwin


On a jet plane with no fear for fallin'
But wishin' it never lands


Reminiscent of the dream time


Presently en route to the rise of the machine time


Magazine times


With coffee more sugar and milk than coffee


Aborted rhymes, rotten beats, and failed hooks


Roads as bumpy as braille books


Fail cools, bad French,
 and mad push at the door

Gourmet food at the starving soiree


A choice of one easy woman at a time
I'll take three the hard way


Trying to be as abstract as possible
And vulgar, the more shocking the more profitable


A baby fed molten gold


And sat upon a pedestal promote getting called 24 carot souls


How to describe this
Insightful remarks such as the best thing I've ever heard is silence


Some more technically impressive


In a faux Spanish romantic hues of a Marxist dialectic


Pleasing to the critics, but pointless is the common passerby


Might as well not even exist, not even a bit


In the event of my demise give everything I prize to the poor


And to the oppressors, I leave a war


And so on and so forth
summary:
These lyrics by Lupe Fiasco touch on themes of self-reflection, inner struggle, social justice, and the complexity of identity. The song seems to explore the dual nature of humanity, the struggle between light and dark, and the search for balance.

The reference to the inner heart and mind being the star that will always shine suggests the importance of staying true to oneself and not letting external forces dim that light. Lupe Fiasco also delves into the idea of transformation and growth, using metaphors such as ninja turtles pouring out of manholes to suggest hidden depths and potential within individuals.

The lyrics also touch on social issues and the desire for change, with references to world peace, the advancement of human suffering, and the struggle against oppression. There is a sense of defiance and resilience in the face of adversity, as well as a call to action to dream, aspire, and challenge the status quo.

Overall, the lyrics convey a sense of introspection, questioning, and a deep understanding of the complexities of the human experience. They invite listeners to reflect on their own inner struggles, social responsibilities, and the potential for transformation and growth.

title: Life of a Savage (Remix)
lyrics:
[Chorus: RondoNumbaNine]

I done been through a lot of shit, seen a lot of shit
I done witnessed a lot of shit, still I talk shit
But it’s the life of a savage
But it’s the life of a savage


[Verse 1: Lupe Fiasco]

Rondo got a nine like Wu-Tang, woo shit!


Thumbs down to the foo shit

Set self for this new shit

L’s up for the Lu shit


One verse like two bricks
Each bar like one rock
Each word like two hits


Got niggas high as two Ricks
Standin’ on the couch yelling out who shit

All my niggas only on business
Rondo need a rollie by Christmas
Rondo need a 'rari by July

And another rollie by Christmas


Nigga I know cause I did this
But I keep it on the low no witness


Put my whole heart in this rap shit


But I done seen a lot of shit and I done did a lot of shit
But my lips sealed like chap-stick


Did my best to get ‘em out the streets
So they don’t get killed by that bitch


Gotta keep moving can’t sit still in that traffic

It’s a savage

Dumb shit, I ain’t wit it

But if you wanna run shit then let’s get it

[Chorus: RondoNumbaNine]

I done been through a lot of shit, seen a lot of shit
I done witnessed a lot of shit, still I talk shit
But it’s the life of a savage
But it’s the life of a savage


[Verse 2: RondoNumbaNine]

Gotta go hard for my bro L'A


Gotta get a deal, no I can't wait
Gotta see a mil right in this day


And if a opp in my lane he gonna meet this K


Whole lotta dope loud pack to the face


In Chiraq cooling where it ain't safe


On the run to the money, yea its a race
Try and try me I'm gonna spray ya like mace
Run up in the spot masked up where the safe?


Fuck all dissing we could meet face to face


Put in a hole in your face, still beat the case


CPDK nigga talk to the jakes

Theres a whole lot of food on my plate

[?]

Glock go BLAH, damn thats great

Rip D-Thang  I ain't going like that


Chilling in the back with mac he make a mess

Say its fucked up but my niggas blessed

My squad, yea we up next


We the fucking best, we gon' fucking flex


On these fucking haters, with these big checks

[Chorus: RondoNumbaNine]

I done been through a lot of shit, seen a lot of shit
I done witnessed a lot of shit, still I talk shit
But it’s the life of a savage
But it’s the life of a savage
summary:
The lyrics talk about the experiences of living a tough and dangerous life, referred to as the life of a savage. The artists discuss witnessing and going through a lot of difficult situations, but still maintaining a tough exterior and talking confidently. They talk about the need to hustle and make money, as well as the realities of violence and danger in their environment.

The metaphor of having a "nine like Wu-Tang" and being ready to defend themselves with a gun reflects the harsh reality of their surroundings. They also mention the importance of loyalty to their friends and their willingness to protect and defend them. The lyrics touch on the themes of resilience, survival, loyalty, and the pursuit of success despite the challenges they face.

title: I’m Beamin’ (Remix)

 (niggas) (Beam)

, 
flier than the super feather

The speakers on bump, the rappers on acne

[Verse 4: Chuck Inglish]

[Verse 6: Blu]

[Verse 7: Diggy Simmons]

I know what you’re thinking, thinking I do not belong

Some of them hate it, but I made it, so I’m never concerned

With my dream and my drive, I determined my turn
In this business, because I’m in control, meeting adjourned

I said, “It’s Third Degree, y’all heard of we?

I’m Dosage, have you heard of me?”
I come from the bottom, so the top where I deserve to be
Where people say, "It doesn’t matter to me much"
I was on the Steppin' Lasers tour, and man, I shook it up
That was random, but so what? Life is a war, better load up
If you against me, come correct
I am the bomb, watch me blow up (Boom!)

I just want to say I remember when

[Verse 9: B.o.B]
Well, it’s B to the O, O to the B
You know it’s the flow, you know that it’s me, I flow to this beat
As easy as going to the store and holding receipts
And folding them neat, I’m focused as focused can be
You know I got phobias, please, approach me with peace

You know she’s a freak
But anyway, back to what I’m supposed to be
Saying all over this beat, you know that we Gs

You see all the crowns, you know that we kings

But we ain’t all odds, we just blaze, man

summary: The lyrics above contain themes of self-confidence, perseverance, and empowerment. The artists express their individuality and uniqueness, embracing their talents and standing out from the crowd. They also touch on the idea of overcoming obstacles and naysayers to achieve success. Metaphors such as "beaming" and "aurora borealis" convey a sense of radiance and brightness, while references to chess and gaming suggest strategic thinking and mastery. Overall, the lyrics carry a message of self-belief, determination, and triumph in the face of adversity.

title: Past My Shades
lyrics:
[Intro: B.o.B]
If you asked me what's on my mind, you probably won't believe it
'Cause if life was one big pool, I'd be in the deep end

So I play my role and never ever speak it, like a secret
And all the while you just try to figure me out (What?)


[Chorus: B.o.B]

But you can't see past my shades
Past my shades, past my shades
And you can't see past my shades
Past my shades, past my shades
And you can't see past my shades
Past my shades, past my shades
And you can't see past my shades
Past my shades, past my shades


[Verse 1: B.o.B]

Well, ask me a question, I tell you no lies
'Cause there's nothing to hide, my soul's in my eyes

And I'm ahead of my time but I cannot rewind

The only thing I fear is the mirror in my bathroom


People look and try to see a disguise
But there is nothing that nobody can't see in light


If it's a song with a rhyme or a verse with a line
Then you understand my mind

[Chorus: B.o.B]

But you can't see past my shades
Past my shades, past my shades
And you can't see past my shades
Past my shades, past my shades
And you can't see past my shades
Past my shades, past my shades
And you can't see past my shades
Past my shades, past my shades


[Verse 2: Lupe Fiasco]
Who else but Lu else?

You know I got two belts, the black and the white one
I begin and I master

I see in my eye glasses

But they saying what I'm seeing through is false like Ross


I can hear him through the wall like "Walk
This Way",
 
trying to dissuade my thoughts
I'm a slave to myself and disobeyed my boss


It's all in disarray this parade I walk
They get amazed when they catch a chain I toss
Amidst this array of different ways I talk
And it hangs from your brain if my chain
 you caught
Like I cough without covering my mouth

I tip the scales like the king of the south


Forgot that I was fat, I lost my way


But now I'm back looking for the shade I sought


And not wonders,
 
I'm Scott Summers
So don't make me take off my stunners


Bobby Ray, you know you got my numbers


And them deer can't see us like hunters

[Chorus: B.o.B]

But you can't see past my shades
Past my shades, past my shades
And you can't see past my shades
Past my shades, past my shades
And you can't see past my shades
Past my shades, past my shades
And you can't see past my shades
Past my shades, past my shades
summary:
These lyrics seem to focus on the idea of hiding one's true self behind a facade or a mask, represented by the metaphor of wearing shades. The artists, B.o.B and Lupe Fiasco, talk about how people may try to figure them out, but they are not easily understood because they keep their true thoughts and feelings hidden. The shades symbolize a barrier or shield that prevents others from truly seeing and understanding them.

The lyrics also touch on themes of self-awareness, introspection, and the complexity of human emotions and thoughts. B.o.B talks about being ahead of his time and not being able to go back, perhaps suggesting a sense of loneliness or isolation in his perspective. Lupe Fiasco's verse delves into the idea of self-mastery, being true to oneself, and navigating through the challenges and distractions in life.

Overall, the lyrics suggest a sense of complexity and depth to the artists' personalities, as well as a sense of mystery and enigma that others may not easily penetrate. The shades serve as a metaphor for the barriers we sometimes put up to protect ourselves, and the struggle to be truly seen and understood by others.

title: Kick, Push (Remix)
lyrics:
[Intro: Lupe Fiasco]
Uh, What up y'all? Yeah
Soundtrakk, what's popping baby?
If y'all ain't know
I go by the name of Lupe Fiasco
Representing that First and Fifteenth, yeah, uh
And this one right here, I dedicate this one right here
To all my homies out there grinding
You know what I'm saying? Legally and illegally, haha
You know what I'm talking about?
So, check it out, uh


[Verse 1: Lupe Fiasco]
First got it when he was six, didn't know any tricks
Matter of fact, first time he got on it, he slipped
Landed on his hip and busted his lip
For a week, he had to talk with a lisp, like thisss
Now we can end the story right here
But shorty didn't quit, it was something in the air
Yeah, he said it was something so appealing
He couldn't fight the feeling, something about it
He knew he couldn't doubt it, couldn't understand it
Branded, since the first kickflip he landed, uh
Labeled a misfit, a bandit
Ka-kunk, ka-kunk, ka-kunk; his neighbors couldn't stand it
So, he was banished to the park
Started in the morning, wouldn't stop 'til after dark

[Hook: Lupe Fiasco]
And so he kick, push, kick, push
Kick, push, kick, push; coast
And away he rolled
Just a rebel to the world with no place to go
And so he kick, push, kick, push
Kick, push, kick, push; coast
So come and skate with me
Just a rebel looking for a place to be
So let's kick
And push
And coast
Uh, uh, uh


[Break: Drake]
What up, Lupe?
Chi-Town, check


[Verse 2: Drake]


My style is very Tennessee mixed with some Terry Kennedy

People barely remember me from back in the day
I done got some contacts and threw the glasses away
The time it took me to get cool was a massive delay, but check

It gets boring growing up in Memphis
Tryna become a pro, but keep showing up apprentice

Mama probably would've done anything to prevent this
Cause every single time I break a board, it gets expensive
Luckily, my aunt workin' as a nurse
So every time I needed something, she just reach up in her purse
And plus, she'd always give me speeches on the first
If I'm stayin' in her house, then I need to get some work
I tell her I was there on vacation
She said, "You need to be doing something other than skatin'
Why don't you go kick it with your uncle in the basement?
I'mma let him know that you comin', honey, he's waitin'"
So now, it's me in old school checkered plaid
Playing chess, looking through some old school record ads
He knew I didn't really wanna post here
Opened up the window and told me that the coast clear
And now I coast clear, take a deep breath
Feeling like the Pope's here, homie, this is recess
This is each test life's ever given me
A-plus graded by a teacher in a sweet dress

Yes, I'm literally Larnell Lewis with a
Kick and a snare
, a kickflip in the air
The kid's sick denim jeans, put a rip in a pair
Just so the space ain't restricted in here, breathe again
Think it's obvious that they need my soul

My cousin's after Doe, like re-mi-fa-so

I said, "Auntie, this is a safe career"
She said, "Drake, I told you there was no skatin' here"

[Hook: Drake]
So I kick, push Kick, push
Kick, push Kick, push Coast
Fast as the wheels replaced
I gotta find another hobby just to fill the space
So I kick, push
Kick, push Kick, push
Kick, push Coast
Peep the way I roll
Just a rebel, lookin' for a place to go
So I kick Then push
And coast


[Verse 3: Lupe Fiasco]
Yeah, yeah
Before he knew, he had a crew that wasn't no punk
In they Spitfire shirts and SB dunks
They would push 'til they couldn't skate no more
Office building lobbies wasn't safe no more
And it wasn't like they wasn't getting chased no more
Just the freedom was better than breathing, they said
An escape route they used to escape out
When things got crazy, they needed to break out
They'd head to any place with stairs
Any good grinds, the world was theirs
And their four wheels would take them there
Until the cops came and said "There's no skating here"

[Hook: Lupe Fiasco]
And so they kick, push, kick, push
Kick, push, kick, push; coast
And away they rolled
Just rebels without a cause with no place to go
And so they kick, push, kick, push
Kick, push, kick, push; coast
So come roll with me
Just a rebel looking for a place to be
So let's kick, uh, uh
And push, yeah, yeah
And coast
Ah ha, Swanky
summary:
These lyrics from Lupe Fiasco and Drake's song "Kick, Push" revolve around the theme of youth rebellion, freedom, and finding one's place in the world. The main metaphor in the song is skateboarding, which represents a form of escape and expression for the main characters. 

The lyrics discuss the struggles and challenges faced by young people who use skateboarding as a way to navigate through life. Skateboarding is portrayed as a means of freedom and self-expression, allowing the characters to break free from societal norms and expectations. The act of "kick, push, coast" on a skateboard becomes a metaphor for persevering through obstacles, finding one's own path, and seeking a sense of belonging.

The song also touches on the idea of family support and guidance, as seen in Drake's verse where his aunt encourages him to pursue other interests besides skateboarding. This highlights the tension between pursuing one's passions and meeting the expectations of others.

Overall, the lyrics convey a sense of defiance, resilience, and the search for identity. The characters in the song find solace and purpose in skateboarding, using it as a way to navigate the challenges of life and assert their individuality.

summary: The lyrics in the above verses touch on themes of success, hard work, self-reflection, and perseverance. The artists talk about being ahead of their time, constantly pushing themselves to do better, and not letting criticism get in the way of their creativity and success. They also highlight the idea of staying true to oneself and not letting outside opinions or distractions affect their work. Metaphors such as being in the lab working on their craft, making papers (money), and being on their grind are used to emphasize their dedication and focus on achieving their goals. Additionally, references to sports figures and iconic characters like Snow White add layers to the lyrics and showcase their creativity in storytelling. Overall, the lyrics convey a sense of confidence, resilience, and determination in the face of challenges and setbacks.

The chorus, sung by Pharrell Williams, emphasizes self-confidence and resilience in the face of jealousy and disrespect. The lyrics above touch on various themes such as faith, struggle, social issues, and self-reflection. Dee-1, Lupe Fiasco, and Big KRIT all express their deep beliefs and values through their verses, emphasizing the importance of staying true to oneself and standing against the challenges and temptations of the world.

Dee-1 talks about the importance of staying real and not compromising one's morals for material gain. He addresses social issues such as violence, poverty, and discrimination, emphasizing the need for unity and love amongst all people, regardless of their background or beliefs. He also highlights the constant battle between good and evil and the importance of faith in overcoming personal demons.

Big KRIT addresses societal issues such as the cycle of poverty and violence in marginalized communities, criticizing the lack of value placed on black lives and the negative influences perpetuated by society. He advocates for building each other up, spreading love, and fighting against injustice and inequality.

Lupe Fiasco adds his perspective on the struggles of living in challenging environments and the importance of perseverance and self-empowerment. He highlights the power of dreams and the resilience needed to overcome obstacles and succeed in a world filled with adversity.

Overall, the lyrics convey a message of hope, resilience, and the importance of staying true to oneself, standing up against injustices, and spreading love and positivity in a world that often seeks to bring us down.

The lyrics in the song "Skate On" by The Game and Lupe Fiasco are filled with references to luxury cars, wealth, and the rap industry. The artists boast about their success and expensive possessions, using metaphors and wordplay to convey their status in the music world.

One of the major themes in the song is success and perseverance. The artists talk about their journey in the rap game, overcoming obstacles, and continuing to strive for greatness. They use metaphors like driving luxury cars and referencing famous figures to emphasize their achievements and determination.

Additionally, there is a sense of defiance and confidence in the lyrics. The artists dismiss haters and critics, asserting their dominance in the industry and portraying themselves as unstoppable forces. They express a sense of pride in their accomplishments and abilities, challenging anyone who doubts them.

Overall, the lyrics in "Skate On" convey a message of power, resilience, and self-assuredness. The artists showcase their skills and success while also acknowledging the challenges they have faced along the way. The song serves as a celebration of their achievements and a declaration of their continued commitment to excellence in their craft.

The artists express a sense of excitement and urgency, capturing the feeling of being fully present and immersed in a romantic experience. The song also features metaphors, such as comparing love to infinity and eternity, and referring to building a relationship as a business venture with "Me and You Industries." The lyrics emphasize the importance of trust, loyalty, and keeping love strong despite potential obstacles or negative energies.

Overall, the song conveys a sense of joy, celebration, and appreciation for the special connection between two individuals. It encourages listeners to embrace love, live in the moment, and cherish the time spent with their partner.

summary:
The lyrics in this song paint a vivid picture of storytelling through music. The chorus emphasizes the use of spray paint and ink pens as tools to create art and express oneself. The gallery being referred to is the beat, indicating that music can serve as a platform for sharing one's stories and experiences.

The verses feature different characters and situations, each showcasing struggles, sacrifices, and moments of decision-making. For example, Ghostface Killah's verse tells the story of a young boy involved in a life of crime, facing the consequences of his actions. Mike Shinoda's verse delves into a tale of greed and betrayal, ultimately leading to tragedy.

Lupe Fiasco's verse introduces a sci-fi element, depicting a heroic sacrifice in a galactic setting. The themes of courage, sacrifice, and selflessness are prominent throughout the song, as characters navigate difficult circumstances and make choices that have lasting consequences.

Overall, the lyrics explore the power of storytelling, the complexities of human nature, and the impact of our actions on ourselves and others. The metaphors of spray paint and ink pens suggest the artistry and creativity involved in crafting narratives and sharing them with the world.

These lyrics speak to the theme of perseverance and resilience in the face of doubt and criticism. The artists in the song are acknowledging the pressure and expectations society places on individuals to conform to certain norms or expectations, whether it be in career choices or personal ambitions. They express the frustration of feeling trapped in someone else's ideals and the desire to break free and pursue their own dreams.

The chorus emphasizes the determination to prove others wrong and assert their identity and worth. The metaphor of wearing someone else's shoes symbolizes the feeling of being forced into a role or path that doesn't feel authentic to oneself. The lyrics also touch on the importance of staying true to oneself and not letting the negativity or skepticism of others deter one from pursuing their goals.

The verses highlight the challenges and obstacles that come with chasing one's dreams, including facing criticism, self-doubt, and societal pressure. The artists share their personal experiences of persevering through adversity and staying committed to their passions despite discouragement or naysayers. Ultimately, the song serves as a rallying cry for self-belief, resilience, and the determination to strive for success on one's own terms.

The above lyrics touch on themes such as social injustice, the harsh realities of life, street life, and the struggles faced by marginalized communities. Papoose talks about the tragic deaths of over one hundred soldiers, the ongoing impact of 9/11, and the prevalence of violence in society. He also emphasizes his skills as a rapper and his dominance in the rap game.

Lupe Fiasco uses vivid metaphors to paint a picture of the corrupting influence of the music industry and societal issues. He describes the game as a beast with destructive elements like drugs, violence, and materialism. The imagery he uses highlights the dark and twisted nature of the industry and the consequences of chasing fame and success at any cost.

Styles P adds to the gritty and raw nature of the cypher with his aggressive delivery and vivid storytelling. He touches on themes of street life, violence, and the struggles faced by those living in tough neighborhoods. He also references influential figures like Malcolm X and Martin Luther King Jr., highlighting the importance of standing up for what is right and fighting against oppression.

Overall, the lyrics in the cypher convey a sense of urgency, social commentary, and raw authenticity. The artists use their verses to shed light on difficult realities and showcase their lyrical skills while also paying homage to the roots of rap and the power of the cypher as a platform for self-expression and storytelling.

summary:
The lyrics in this song "Tightrope" by B.o.B, Lupe Fiasco, and Janelle Monáe touch on themes of balance, perseverance, resilience, and staying true to oneself in the face of challenges. The metaphor of walking a tightrope represents the balancing act of life and the constant juggling of highs and lows, success and failure. Despite the obstacles and pressures, the artists in the song continue to tip on the tightrope, remaining steady and focused on their goals.

B.o.B talks about his unconventional approach to music and how he embraces the haters and challenges that have propelled him forward. Lupe Fiasco speaks about challenging traditional norms and thinking outside the box, while Janelle Monáe celebrates her versatility and ability to navigate through different situations effortlessly.

Overall, the lyrics convey a message of resilience, determination, and the importance of staying true to oneself despite the ups and downs of life. The artists encourage listeners to keep pushing forward, to stay balanced, and to continue tipping on the tightrope of life.

summary:
The lyrics in the song "Swang on 'Em" by Enigma featuring Bun B and Lupe Fiasco touch on several major themes and metaphors related to Southern hip-hop culture, boasting, and resilience.

One of the main themes in the song is the pride and confidence in Southern hip-hop culture, specifically the Dirty South. Bun B's verse references the hustle and grit of the Southern streets, emphasizing the importance of respect and loyalty within the community. The use of terms like "dirty mouth" and "dirty D" signifies the raw and unapologetic nature of the Southern rap scene.

The metaphor of "swang on 'em" represents a form of asserting dominance and showing off in the rap game. It signifies the act of confidently flaunting one's success and skills, particularly when it comes to driving expensive cars with flashy rims. The repeated mention of "candy paint" and "22s or better" highlights the importance of appearances and status symbols in the rap world.

Lupe Fiasco's verse adds a different perspective to the song, bringing in his Chicago roots and acknowledging the influence of Southern rap culture on his music. He pays homage to iconic figures in Southern hip-hop, such as UGK and Mike Jones, while also asserting his own unique style and identity.

Overall, the lyrics in "Swang on 'Em" celebrate Southern hip-hop culture, pride, and resilience, while also showcasing the diversity and influence of artists from different regions coming together in the rap game.

summary: The above lyrics talk about a deep love and pride for one's city, despite its flaws and challenges. The artists celebrate the uniqueness and sense of belonging that comes from being a part of a city, from its diverse neighborhoods to its problems and solutions. The song also addresses issues like segregation, discrimination, and gentrification, highlighting the struggles and inequalities that exist within urban environments. Despite these challenges, the artists express a strong attachment to their city and a determination to stay and fight for positive change. The chorus emphasizes the deep connection and loyalty that the artists feel towards their city, no matter what obstacles they may face. The bridge further highlights this deep connection, stating that the city is a part of them and cannot be taken away. Overall, the lyrics convey a complex mix of love, pride, and acknowledgment of the difficulties that come with being a part of a city.

The lyrics above highlight the frustration and disillusionment towards political leaders, particularly President Barack Obama, and the American government. The artists criticize Obama for his policies, including the war on terror, military interventions, and lack of action in addressing social issues. They question his integrity and portray him as a puppet of the Western power structure.

Themes such as revolution, oppression, imperialism, and activism are prevalent throughout the lyrics. The artists express a desire for change and accountability within the government, calling out the hypocrisy and injustice present in political actions. They highlight the need for individuals to be aware, informed, and actively involved in challenging the status quo.

Metaphors such as "Obama Nation" and references to historical figures like Malcolm X and Nkrumah serve to contextualize the present political climate and critique the systemic problems within the American power structure. The lyrics urge listeners to question authority, seek truth, and resist the normalization of oppression and violence.

Overall, the lyrics convey a message of seeking a genuine connection with someone who is not just a romantic interest, but a true partner and friend. The artists emphasize the importance of mutual respect, communication, and support in building a meaningful relationship.

The lyrics explore the idea that despite people coming from different backgrounds and lifestyles, at the core, everyone wants the same things in life. The song talks about issues of inequality, the struggle to make a living, and the desire for equality and fairness in society. It also delves into the idea of making changes and taking action to create a better world for everyone.

The use of metaphors such as gangster friends, skater friends, DJ's in the clubs, Jesus freaks, and thugs illustrates the diversity of people who all share common desires and goals. The lyrics also highlight the need for individuals to come together and fight for justice and equality, regardless of their backgrounds or beliefs.

Overall, the song sends a powerful message about unity, empathy, and the shared human experience of wanting a better life for oneself and others. It encourages listeners to think outside the box, challenge the status quo, and work towards creating a more equitable and just society for all.

Hitchcock on the beat,

summary:
The above lyrics depict a gritty and dark portrayal of society, likening it to a "zombie land" where survival is key and violence is rampant. The idea of shooting someone in the arm only for them to come back again references the resilience and determination of individuals in dangerous environments. The repeated mention of zombies and references to horror movies suggest a sense of chaos, unpredictability, and fear in the world.

Themes of survival, desperation, and the harsh realities of life are prevalent throughout the lyrics. The imagery of hustlers constantly on the move and the need to be constantly vigilant to avoid being taken advantage of or harmed paints a picture of a dangerous and cutthroat environment.

Metaphors like comparing oneself to a vampire or a monster highlight the darker aspects of human nature and the lengths people may go to in order to survive or thrive in such a challenging environment. The references to famous horror characters and authors add to the overall eerie and unsettling tone of the lyrics.

Overall, the lyrics convey a sense of struggle, survival, and the harsh realities of life in a dangerous world, using vivid and dark imagery to paint a picture of a society that is chaotic, unforgiving, and unpredictable.

Overall, the lyrics in this song serve as a reminder to focus on what truly matters and not get distracted by outside influences or temptations. By sticking to the fundamentals and staying true to oneself, one can navigate through life with authenticity and success.

Overall, the lyrics capture the complex emotions and struggles that come with trying to navigate the end of a relationship and the lingering feelings that can persist even after it's over.

summary:
The lyrics seem to be exploring the idea that pursuing pleasure and happiness at all costs can ultimately lead to pain and suffering. The idea of external appearances being in a rush while inner feelings are out of touch suggests a disconnect between the surface level of happiness and the deeper emotional turmoil underneath. The mention of being pulverized into dust and the rising poltergeist could symbolize the destructive nature of seeking pleasure without regard for the consequences.

The lyrics also touch on themes of internal conflict, power dynamics, and the impact of societal pressure on individual happiness. The reference to the famous nameless angels and the weakness of the powerful could suggest a critique of those in positions of influence who may struggle with their own internal battles.

The repetition of "Your happiness is killing me" emphasizes the idea that prioritizing personal pleasure and happiness can have negative repercussions for others. The mention of fantasy and romanticizing insanity could speak to the dangers of losing touch with reality in the pursuit of happiness.

Overall, the lyrics seem to be cautioning against the pursuit of pleasure at the expense of others and highlighting the potential harm that can come from prioritizing personal happiness above all else.

Overall, the lyrics convey a message of resilience, determination, and the fight for success despite obstacles. The artists share their personal struggles and experiences, showing that even in the face of adversity, they continue to push forward and strive for greatness.

The lyrics "Touch the Sky" by Kanye West featuring Lupe Fiasco touch on themes of perseverance, overcoming obstacles, and achieving success. The song speaks to Kanye's journey in the music industry, starting from humble beginnings and working his way up to the top. He talks about facing challenges, doubters, and setbacks but ultimately pushing through and reaching his goals.

The metaphor of "touching the sky" symbolizes reaching for the highest level of success and fulfillment. It represents ambition, determination, and the drive to achieve one's dreams. Kanye reflects on his past struggles and the sacrifices he made in order to become successful, acknowledging his mistakes and learning from them along the way.

Lupe Fiasco's verse adds another layer to the song, emphasizing the importance of staying true to oneself and representing one's roots. The imagery of being "sky high" suggests a sense of empowerment, confidence, and pride in one's accomplishments.

Overall, "Touch the Sky" is a motivational anthem that encourages listeners to keep pushing forward, believe in themselves, and strive for greatness despite the challenges they may face. It celebrates the journey of growth and self-discovery, as well as the triumph of achieving one's dreams.

title: Dirty Rose

summary:
These lyrics from Lupe Fiasco convey a sense of confidence, defiance, and uniqueness. The mention of being Emperor and Rosemary's baby suggests a combination of power and darkness. The comparison of oneself to the Autobahn and Autobot implies speed, strength, and futuristic elements.

The mention of being an optimist while speaking from the hood reflects a sense of resilience and optimism despite facing challenges and adversity. The reference to punk-rock elements and New Wave music shows a blend of different genres and influences, highlighting Lupe's eclectic style.

Overall, these lyrics showcase Lupe Fiasco's self-assuredness, creativity, and ability to mix various elements and influences in his music. The mention of DNA and PMA (positive mental attitude) suggests a focus on individuality and positivity in the face of obstacles. The inclusion of collaborations with Sarah Green and references to artists like Rakim and LL Cool J show a respect for the past while also pushing boundaries and carving out a unique path in the music industry.

The lyrics celebrate the team's history of success, including references to championship wins and key players like Michael Jordan and Joakim Noah.

There are themes of loyalty and pride in the team, with the lyrics encouraging fans to stand up, put their hands up, and represent for the city. The mention of jerseys, Jordans, and home and away colors highlights the cultural importance of sports fashion and team spirit.

Metaphors such as "touch the banners," "city for the winners," and "shut that down because we got that defense" convey a sense of achievement, celebration, and resilience. The imagery of the city in the winter and the statue outside the arena adds to the sense of place and community that the Bulls represent.

Overall, the lyrics convey a sense of passion, enthusiasm, and unity among Bulls fans, celebrating the team's legacy and success while also highlighting the city of Chicago as a place of pride and resilience.

summary:
The lyrics seem to convey a message of finding contentment and joy in the simple things in life, despite facing struggles and challenges. The idea of being in a "million star motel" represents finding beauty and luxury in everyday experiences and moments, even when faced with difficulties.

The mention of being "locked underneath the cellar door" and "bent til I broke but never poor" could symbolize feeling trapped or overwhelmed, but never losing hope or resilience. The imagery of diamonds shining in the sky and the world being a million star motel suggests finding beauty and wonder in the world around us, even in the darkest of times.

The verses from Lupe Fiasco and Black Thought emphasize the importance of perspective and gratitude. Lupe Fiasco talks about providing comfort and luxury to those in need, while Black Thought reflects on finding joy and contentment despite external circumstances.

Overall, the lyrics seem to highlight the power of positivity, resilience, and gratitude in finding happiness and beauty in life's challenges. The metaphor of the million star motel serves as a reminder to appreciate the small joys and experiences that make life rich and fulfilling.

Jesus Christ, we need you to intercede for 'em

[Hook: Jim Lavigne]

[Verse 3: Lupe Fiasco]
Now I got 'em, back of the ambulance tryna to stop 'em

No other choice but to shock him, blood pressure droppin'
But he's a fighter, he's a boxer
Unless he wants to leave Ali's his only option

He sees the butterflies but tryna keep him conscience

His oxygen flow constant, it's just a consequence
And I've chauferred many and barely saved any
And I say he's about 20, not a bad paramedic they just good with the semis
So I don't feel bad, I gave everything in me
To bring him back to life, now I see his light dimming
Feel his soul slipping, he's all done
Turn the sirens off, we just lost one
summary:
The lyrics depict a gritty and intense narrative of urban violence and the consequences of gang activity. The hook emphasizes the finality and inevitability of death when faced with gunfire. The verses tell the stories of individuals caught up in the cycle of violence, from the pressure to join gangs at a young age to the tragic outcomes of confrontations.

Themes of desperation, survival, and the harsh realities of street life are prevalent throughout the lyrics. The mention of famous warriors, strangled men, and the presence of guns creates a vivid picture of a dangerous and unforgiving environment. The use of metaphors, such as describing the feeling of being stuck between a rock and a hard place, adds depth to the portrayal of the struggles faced by those living in violent neighborhoods.

The verse by Lupe Fiasco adds a perspective from a paramedic trying to save a life in the midst of chaos, highlighting the human cost of the violence described in the previous verses. The overall message of the song seems to be a reflection on the senseless loss of life and the harsh realities of urban violence.

The lyrics touch on themes of resilience, survival, social issues, and the pursuit of success despite adversity. Gemini reflects on his life experiences, including his troubled family relationships, insecurities, and struggles with self-esteem. Gemini's lyrics emphasize the importance of faith, perseverance, and self-improvement. He acknowledges the obstacles he has overcome and the need to fight for progress and justice. His words are a call to action for empowerment and unity within marginalized communities.

Lupe Fiasco's verse adds to the themes of perseverance and success, highlighting the journey from inner-city struggles to global recognition. He references his own come-up in the music industry, showcasing his determination and talent as an artist.

Overall, the lyrics convey a message of hope, resilience, and the importance of standing up for oneself and others in the face of adversity. They emphasize the power of self-belief, hard work, and community support in overcoming challenges and achieving success.

Overall, these lyrics convey the power and impact of love in our lives, showing how it can bring us joy, healing, growth, and even self-discovery. Love is portrayed as a force that can challenge us, change us, and ultimately bring us closer to our true selves and others.

These lyrics seem to convey a sense of being on the outskirts or margins of society and feeling the pressure to conform or fit in. The references to being radioactive and sociopathic could symbolize feeling different or outcast, and the old tactics mentioned could refer to oppressive systems or norms that try to keep individuals down. The repetition of "critical mass" could suggest a breaking point or a tipping point where change or resistance becomes necessary. The mention of buying more and the emphasis on design and law could point to consumerism and societal structures that perpetuate inequalities.

Overall, the lyrics seem to touch on themes of individuality, resistance, and the struggle against oppressive forces. The imagery of being on the outskirts and blending out could represent a desire to break free from societal expectations and norms, even if it means being seen as an outsider.

summary:
The lyrics in the song "The Bad Don't Seem So Wrong" by Lupe Fiasco and Trae touch on various themes such as struggle, resilience, and finding hope in difficult situations. The artists explore the idea of facing adversity and trying to make sense of the chaos and pain in life. They discuss the internal and external battles one may face, whether it be dealing with personal hardships or societal injustices.

The hook of the song emphasizes how sometimes in the stillness of the night, the challenges and hardships don't seem as overwhelming or negative. This could be seen as a coping mechanism or a way to find solace in moments of quiet reflection.

The verses dive deeper into the struggles individuals face, from trying to justify violence to battling personal demons and external forces. The artists paint a picture of resilience and determination, urging listeners to keep fighting and holding on, even when the odds seem stacked against them.

Overall, the song conveys a message of perseverance and the power of pushing through tough times, even when it feels like everything is falling apart. The metaphor of wearing pain like a pair of shoes or carrying it like a burden highlights the idea of enduring suffering while still striving for better days. The lyrics suggest that through perseverance and strength, one can overcome even the most challenging circumstances.

Overall, the lyrics express a sense of passion, determination, and a call to action to take a leap of faith and pursue love despite the challenges that may come their way. It encourages open communication, mutual support, and a willingness to face whatever comes their way together.

summary:
The lyrics seem to be exploring themes of authenticity, perception, and self-awareness. The verses talk about appearances and how people present themselves to the world, with references to clean outfits, fancy cars, and other outward displays of success. The singer acknowledges the facade that people often put on, but also seems to appreciate the realness and honesty that can come through in genuine connections.

There is a contrast between the superficiality of the "clean" image and the "dirty" reality beneath the surface. The hook emphasizes this dichotomy, with the cleanliness of the appearance contrasting with the dirtiness of the truth or the real emotions underneath. The lyrics suggest that people don't have to lie or put on a front to be accepted or appreciated for who they truly are.

The appearance of cleanliness and perfection is portrayed as a facade that can be deceptive, while the "dirty" or real aspects of a person are what make them genuine and authentic. The song also touches on relationships and how people interact with each other, hinting at the complexities of human connections and the importance of being genuine and true to oneself.

The lyrics seem to convey a sense of triumph over adversity and rising above one's circumstances. The artists talk about starting from the bottom and facing challenges, but ultimately finding success and reaching the top. There is a theme of perseverance, growth, and self-improvement throughout the verses.

The metaphor of starting from the bottom and making it to the top is a common theme in hip-hop and reflects the struggles and obstacles faced in life. The artists also touch on themes of self-discovery, self-acceptance, and gratitude for their journey and the people who have supported them along the way.

The references to their roots, hometowns, and personal experiences add depth to the lyrics and show the importance of staying true to oneself while also evolving and growing. The collaboration of different artists from different backgrounds also highlights the power of unity and coming together to achieve success.

Overall, the lyrics convey a message of resilience, empowerment, and celebrating one's accomplishments despite the challenges faced.

The lyrics in the song represent themes of success, perseverance, and self-confidence. Lupe Fiasco's verse speaks to the challenges and obstacles faced by Black individuals in a predominantly white society, highlighting the importance of seizing opportunities and making the most of limited chances. He emphasizes the idea of making the most of life and not wasting opportunities, as symbolized by the metaphor of only having one life to live. 

Pharrell's verse delves into the complexities of fame and success, touching on the pressure and expectations that come with being in the spotlight. He mentions being misunderstood and underestimated, but still striving to prove his worth and talent. The references to being constantly scrutinized and criticized by others reflect the harsh realities of the music industry.

Diggy Simmons' verse showcases his confidence and ambition as a young artist, asserting his talent and determination to succeed. He references his rapid rise to fame and the doubters he has faced along the way, but remains unfazed and focused on his goals. The mention of Big Meech and New York signifies his pride in his roots and desire to represent his city.

Overall, the song conveys a message of resilience, ambition, and self-assurance in the face of adversity. It encourages listeners to stay true to themselves, work hard, and not let criticisms or setbacks hold them back. It is a celebration of individuality and success in the music industry.

summary:
The lyrics above appear to be a collaboration between Lupe Fiasco and Sway, with a focus on themes such as love, success, fame, and travel. Lupe Fiasco's verses showcase his confidence in his artistry, referencing his global travels, interactions with fans, and his ability to effortlessly create music. He uses metaphors such as being compared to Curious George, finding inspiration in the Louvre, and his music turning milk into Tasty Freeze. The hook, "We love you," reflects the admiration and support he receives from his fans.

Sway's verses touch on his ambition to succeed in the music industry, his dedication to his craft, and his determination to make his mark on the world. He discusses the barriers he faces as an artist, the struggles of balancing love and career, and his journey to America to pursue his dreams. The metaphor of music being compared to a female he desires emphasizes the passion and dedication he has for his craft.

Overall, the lyrics convey a sense of ambition, dedication, and the challenges that come with pursuing success in the music industry. The artists express their love for their craft and their gratitude towards their fans for their support.

The lyrics above delve into the concept of layers within layers, the idea that what is presented on the surface may not always be the full truth. The metaphor of boxes within boxes represents the idea of never-ending complexity and hidden depths in life. Aesop Rock and Lupe Fiasco explore the themes of identity, perception, and uncovering hidden truths.

The references to Pandora's box and the metaphor of oral coral reefs suggest a sense of exploration and discovery within oneself. The mention of Mario Kart and Forza alludes to the idea of navigating through life's challenges and obstacles. The lyrics also touch on the dichotomy between appearances and reality, urging listeners to look beyond the surface and question what they see.

Overall, the lyrics encourage a deeper introspection and a willingness to challenge preconceived notions. They suggest that there is always more to discover and understand, both within ourselves and in the world around us.

The artists express their disappointment and frustration with Obama's presidency, highlighting issues such as the continued wars in Iraq and Afghanistan, drone strikes in various countries, and the lack of meaningful change despite his status as the first Black president.

The artists use strong language and imagery to convey their disapproval of Obama's policies. They accuse him of being a puppet for the military-industrial complex, continuing the same oppressive tactics as previous administrations, and failing to live up to the hopes and expectations placed on him by the American people.

The lyrics also touch on themes of racism, imperialism, and government corruption. They question the legitimacy of the War on Terror, criticize the mainstream media for perpetuating propaganda, and call out other political figures who have supported or benefited from these destructive policies.

Overall, the lyrics paint a bleak picture of the state of American politics and highlight the ongoing struggles for justice, peace, and accountability in the face of powerful interests. They urge listeners to question authority, think critically about the information they are fed, and advocate for a better future for all.

summary:
The lyrics of this song convey a sense of determination, resilience, and authenticity. The artists talk about setting goals, facing challenges, and staying true to themselves in the face of adversity. There is a sense of empowerment and self-empowerment throughout the lyrics, as well as a recognition of the importance of staying true to one's own experiences and emotions.

The hook speaks to the idea of finding inspiration and setting goals, shining brightly like solar power and making the most out of every opportunity. The verses delve into personal struggles, overcoming obstacles, and making the most out of difficult situations. There is also a sense of loyalty to one's roots and community, as well as a willingness to push boundaries and challenge norms.

The metaphors used in the lyrics, such as references to paper flipping, ghostwriting, and rap battles, allude to the artists' journey in the music industry and their experiences with success and failure. The mention of facing legal troubles, dealing with loss, and finding motivation in the face of adversity adds depth to the narrative of the song.

Overall, the lyrics convey a message of resilience, determination, and authenticity, urging listeners to stay true to themselves, set goals, and keep pushing forward in the face of challenges. The artists' personal experiences and emotions shine through, creating a powerful and meaningful narrative for the listener.

The artist reflects on the expectations placed on them by others and the struggles they face in finding their own identity and purpose. The themes of humility, gratitude, and the dangers of ego are prominent throughout the song. The artist acknowledges the challenges they have faced and the growth they have experienced, ultimately coming to a place of self-acceptance and confidence.

The metaphor of "beaming" symbolizes the artist's sense of pride and self-assurance, while the reference to "Losers" portrays a sense of defiance against those who doubted them. The artist also explores the complexities of love and relationships, expressing a desire for connection and understanding amidst feelings of pain and loss.

Overall, the lyrics convey a sense of resilience and determination in the face of adversity. The artist embraces their own uniqueness and refuses to be defined by others' expectations, ultimately finding strength in their own voice and truth.

Overall, the lyrics in "Mastered" reflect a sense of pride and self-assurance, as the speaker confidently asserts their talents and superiority over others. The song celebrates individuality, creativity, and the drive to succeed in the face of challenges.

The repeated mention of time ticking down and the need to keep moving forward could symbolize the transient nature of life and the importance of making the most of every moment. The idea of forgetting our names and escaping the pain could represent letting go of past struggles or worries and embracing a new beginning. It could also be seen as a metaphor for immersing ourselves in the present moment and finding joy in the simple things. Ultimately, the lyrics seem to encourage us to embrace life's ups and downs, pick up the pieces when things fall apart, and keep moving forward with a positive attitude.

He speaks about his rise to fame and the challenges he faced along the way. Drake's verse delves into the complexities of fame and relationships, as he reflects on the sacrifices he has made for his career and the impact it has had on his personal life. Bow Wow's verse touches on themes of materialism and self-confidence, as he boasts about his wealth and success in the music industry. He presents himself as a confident and flashy figure, reveling in his accomplishments and status.

Overall, the lyrics convey a sense of longing, reflection, and self-assurance in the face of success and the pressures that come with it. The artists grapple with the effects of their fame on their relationships and personal lives, as well as the sacrifices they have made to achieve their goals.

The lyrics in the song "Kiss Me" by Fiasco featuring Tha'Rayne explore themes of love, desire, patience, and taking risks in relationships. The narrator expresses their longing for a romantic connection with someone, openly admitting their attraction and desire for that person to make a move. They struggle with their impatience and the need to be patient, emphasizing the anticipation and excitement of waiting for a kiss.

The song also touches on the metaphor of butterflies in the stomach, symbolizing the nervousness and excitement of being around someone they have feelings for. The reference to "shutting up and kissing" reflects the urge to move past words and into physical affection, highlighting the intensity of the emotions involved.

Additionally, Lupe Fiasco's verse adds a playful and flirtatious element to the song, with his references to being nicknamed "Rico Suave" and the charm he uses to potentially win over the object of his affection. Overall, the lyrics convey a sense of romantic longing, anticipation, and the desire for a deeper connection with someone special.

summary:
The above lyrics convey themes of self-belief, perseverance, and staying true to oneself in the face of adversity. The hook emphasizes the idea of being a superstar and not letting fear or doubt hold you back from shining on stage. It speaks to the desire for recognition and validation, whether from the camera, the crowd, or the lights.

The verses by ApolloX delve into personal struggles and the challenges of growing up and finding one's place in the world. He talks about the importance of staying true to oneself and not letting negativity or setbacks deter you from your goals. The references to memories, teenage years, and achieving greatness all hint at the journey of self-discovery and growth that comes with pursuing one's dreams.

Overall, the lyrics serve as a reminder to believe in yourself, embrace your uniqueness, and strive for greatness despite the obstacles that may come your way. The metaphor of being a superstar can be interpreted as reaching your full potential and making a lasting impact on the world. It encourages listeners to continue pushing forward, even when faced with challenges and doubters.

summary:
The lyrics of the song "Slow Down" by Lupe Fiasco, Eva, and Poo Bear carry a message about the importance of taking a step back and slowing down in life. The song emphasizes the need to be cautious and self-aware, to avoid rushing into situations that could potentially cause harm.

The metaphor of driving too fast and not slowing down is used throughout the song to symbolize the recklessness and impulsiveness that can lead to negative consequences. The lyrics urge the listener to be mindful of their actions, to pay attention to the signs and warnings, and to not ignore the advice of others who are looking out for their well-being.

The idea of saving tears for a rainy day suggests that emotional distress and regrets can be avoided if one takes the time to pause, reflect, and make wise choices. The lyrics also touch on themes of self-care, self-preservation, and learning from past experiences.

Overall, the song encourages the listener to prioritize their mental and emotional health, to listen to their intuition, and to slow down in order to navigate life with greater thoughtfulness and care.

The lyrics explore themes of redemption, forgiveness, faith, and the belief in a higher power. Davis Absolute expresses gratitude for the sacrifice made by Jesus Christ, emphasizing the cleansing power of His blood and the redemption it offers. The lyrics also touch on the idea of living a life that is pleasing to God and striving to make Him proud. 

The metaphor of being forgiven and redeemed through the shedding of Jesus' blood is a central theme in the lyrics. Davis Absolute acknowledges his own imperfections and the need for divine intervention to be made whole again. The imagery of a broken body and spilled blood symbolize the ultimate sacrifice made for humanity's salvation.

The chorus reaffirms the idea of being watched over by God and the desire to live a life that reflects His grace and love. The determination to make God proud reflects a deep sense of devotion and commitment to spiritual growth and righteousness.

Overall, the lyrics convey a sense of humility, gratitude, and a deep faith in the transformative power of divine forgiveness.

Drake reflects on his own rise to fame and success, and the impact it has had on his relationships. He talks about how success can bring pain and loneliness, and how it can change the dynamics of relationships.

Overall, the lyrics convey a sense of the complexities of achieving success and the impact it can have on one's personal life and relationships. They also touch on themes of authenticity, perspective, and the price of fame.

The artists talk about witnessing and going through a lot of difficult situations, but still talking tough and persevering through it all. 

Some of the major themes in the lyrics include resilience, survival, loyalty to friends and family, the desire for success and wealth, and the harsh realities of street life. The artists use metaphors like having a "nine like Wu-Tang" and references to drugs and violence to paint a vivid picture of their experiences and the environment they come from.

Overall, the lyrics reflect the challenges and dangers of growing up in a tough neighborhood, but also the determination to succeed and make it out despite the obstacles. It portrays a raw and unapologetic view of the reality of living a "savage" lifestyle.

Grammy Awards, my momma next to it


Let's do it
summary:
These lyrics seem to explore themes of wealth, success, and relationships. The idea that money is not everything and that true wealth comes from having good health and meaningful connections is a central theme. The lyrics also touch upon the importance of having support and companionship, whether it's in the form of friends, family, or romantic partners.

Metaphors such as comparing money to wealth, a penny to a quarter, or a chain to gold, are used to emphasize the idea that there are levels to everything and that true value comes from what you surround yourself with. The lyrics also touch upon the idea of status, with references to luxury cars, designer brands, and award shows.

Overall, the lyrics seem to convey a message of appreciating what you have, valuing relationships and connections, and striving for success while staying true to yourself.

summary:
The lyrics of the song "I'm On" by Lupe Fiasco, Trae Tha Truth, Big Boi, Wale, and Poo Bear touch on themes of perseverance, self-confidence, success, and staying true to oneself in the face of challenges. The artists talk about their journeys, struggles, and triumphs in the music industry and in life in general.

The chorus repeats the phrase "I'm on," which can be interpreted as a declaration of being in control, on top of their game, and unstoppable. The verses by Lupe Fiasco, Trae Tha Truth, Big Boi, and Wale delve into personal experiences, societal issues, and the drive to succeed despite obstacles.

Metaphors and imagery are used throughout the song to convey a sense of determination and resilience. For example, references to sports like basketball (Carmelo), track and field (Jackie Joyner-Kersee), and boxing (Rodney King) are used to illustrate the artists' competitive drive and willpower. The mention of fast-paced lifestyles and the struggle for success in the music industry are also depicted through vivid language and wordplay.

Overall, the song "I'm On" conveys a message of strength, ambition, and the unwavering commitment to achieve one's goals, even in the face of adversity. The artists express their confidence in their abilities and their readiness to face any challenges that come their way.

These lyrics seem to explore themes of love, loss, longing, and emotional turmoil. The chorus talks about holding onto sorrows and feeling lost in thoughts, reflecting on feelings of doubt and uncertainty. The verses delve deeper into feelings of pain and the struggle to move on from past hurt. Metaphors like being a candle scorching hot or fading away symbolize the intensity of emotions and the fleeting nature of life.

The bridge introduces a sense of desperation and a fear of disappointment, emphasizing the importance of love and connection. The interlude adds a layer of introspection, acknowledging personal growth and the need to move forward despite hardships. The lyrics by Big Sean and Kid Cudi express a yearning for love and a deep connection with others, portraying love as a saving grace and an essential part of life.

Overall, these lyrics seem to capture the complexities of human emotions, relationships, and the constant struggle to find love and happiness amidst the challenges of life.

The lyrics in the song "I'm Beamin" by Lupe Fiasco featuring HusL touch on themes of overcoming obstacles, self-confidence, personal growth, and resilience. The artists reflect on how people used to doubt them or talk negatively about them, but now they are shining and thriving. The metaphor of "beamin" represents a sense of radiance, success, and positivity.

HusL's verses showcase his lyrical prowess and determination to succeed despite challenges. He describes his journey of self-discovery and self-improvement, emphasizing the importance of hard work and persistence in achieving his goals. The use of metaphors such as "crafting his own beer" and "diving in with Poseidon's grin" adds depth to his message of taking control of his destiny.

Overall, the lyrics convey a message of empowerment, self-belief, and the ability to rise above negativity and doubts. The song serves as a reminder to continue pursuing one's dreams and embracing one's own unique path to success.

title: Linger (Demo)
lyrics:
[Intro]
Linger, the rapper and the singer
Snatching at distraction but collapsing at the fingers
Guarantee it’ll stand the test of time until it’s crackin' at the femurs
Constant residues of you, proves that love was never true
summary:
These lyrics seem to convey a sense of longing and struggle in love. The speaker may be referring to a past relationship that has left them feeling broken and with lingering feelings. The metaphor of "collapsing at the fingers" suggests a lack of control or hold on the situation, while "cracking at the femurs" implies a deep level of pain and vulnerability.

The reference to "constant residues of you" could symbolize the lingering memories and emotions that the speaker is unable to shake off. Despite the facade of distraction, it seems like the love they once believed in was not genuine or lasting. The themes of heartbreak, disillusionment, and the passage of time are evident in these lyrics, creating a melancholic and reflective tone.

title: Thinking
lyrics:
Thinking

You be thinking it’s wrong. They be thinking it’s righ- I ainght getting no sleep. I just blink every night/ sink my teeth in the bite- but there’s police in your sight-and they don’t think of who’s left- when they thinking they right/ they just think of the wars. They just think of the fight/ kids losing they life/ a different one every one ever night / you trying to think of a dream/ you pray to God for the sight- but I ainght getting no sleep I just blink every night/



Who thinks of thinks of losing control and lose patience/ I was making food for the soul but who taste it/ home run when I swing flows the moves bases/ now who’s racist just tie up your shoe laces-cause you’ve been getting tricked out the park - you can’t take it- Democrat-republican no matter what you smother in/ massa kill daddy and mama still love him- even if it’s not by choice-you fell stuck with him/ and that’s a fast ball for your ass dog - you ducking em/ 1 finger ainght hushing him.  see the discussion is-dollar signs what black lives- that ainght rushing em/ your lossy post on Facebook hat ainght touching em-your rants ainght crushing em-friends ainght a discussion em-fans lost trust in him-you what that discussing is/ taking off all your cloths and dudes rushing in/ you gone have to change your pose/ this called suffering



The coke era- courtesy of the government- the dealers and the addicts don’t know better they loving it/ bougie in your goyard purse -you just discovered it/ you mouth only says your a fool when you uncover it/ redlining means you can’t move up in their neighborhood- breadlines- cause they’ll give you food if you stay away for good/ it’s past time - I’m a just call it the re-awaking/ flat line- cause you I know I died to even say this shit/ they wanna hear stories about all my street glory/ lord verse and VITO/ like what have they done for me/ on the block hustling but I was just a shorty- and my daddy would have killed me if he knew I was supporting/ the same black narrative/ of shooting with 40-smoking weed and getting high no matter what he did for me/ I pray that my son never ignore me/ and i'm rethink on everything that he taught me
summary:
The above lyrics touch on themes of injustice, racism, inequality, and the struggles faced by Black communities in society. The artist talks about the lack of sleep and constant awareness of police presence, highlighting the fear and uncertainty experienced by many people of color. The lyrics also address the impact of systemic racism, political divides, and the generational cycle of poverty and violence.

The reference to the "coke era" and government involvement in the drug trade speaks to the systemic issues that have plagued communities of color for decades. The mention of redlining and breadlines underscores the economic disparities and barriers faced by marginalized communities.

Overall, the lyrics convey a sense of frustration, anger, and a call for change. The artist challenges the listener to confront uncomfortable truths and reflect on the impact of societal injustices. The reference to personal experiences and reflections on family dynamics add depth and authenticity to the message.

summary:
The lyrics of the song depict Wippa as someone who has a constant struggle with his food cravings and overeating. The references to cookie jars, fudge, snacks, and junk food highlight his continuous battle with unhealthy eating habits. The mention of Wippa fitting multiple cookies or indulging in a cooking spree emphasizes his excessive food consumption. 

The lyrics also touch on themes of indulgence, temptation, and self-control. Wippa is portrayed as someone who gives in to his cravings and indulges in unhealthy food choices despite knowing the consequences. The mention of Wippa eating for Australia and not being able to fit into his sweater suggests a lack of self-control and awareness about his eating habits.

The collaboration between Lupe Fiasco, Guy Sebastian, and Fitzy adds humor to the lyrics, but also brings attention to the issue of overeating and its impact on one's health. The chorus, emphasizing Wippa's constant raiding of cookie jars and questioning his weight, highlights the consequences of his unhealthy eating habits.

Overall, the lyrics serve as a playful yet thought-provoking commentary on food consumption, self-control, and the struggles of overcoming unhealthy eating habits.
